title: Leo4x200.iso
description:
Remix of Leo4Allv3.  Changed the boot Extensions and Extensions.mkext to allow the DVD to boot and install on the x200 chipset (or at least on the Compaq Presario v2000 implementation of said chipset).

It will not produce an immediately working install!

Post installation, reboot the DVD, but use the following option to point it at your installation

rd=diskXsX  (or rd=disk0s2, or rd=disk0s1...disk[number]s[partition]  Get it?)

After startup-

Open a Terminal Window and type

sudo -s

[enter your password]

Then type

su

You are now logged in as root and can copy any needed kexts for your installation either from the DVD (@ /Volumes/"DVD name"/System/Library/Extensions/*** kexts ***) or from the internet, whatever...

Use at your own risk. blah, blah.
